node.html:
• Assisted in Legionnairesâ€™ disease research by generating datasets of the locations of cooling towers by implementing an AI solution to identify cooling towers using satellite imagery.
  • Repaired and improved a pre-trained computer visions model built using PyTorch with the YoloV5 and EfficientNet B5 models.
  • Increased detection accuracy from 50% to 91% by leveraging several different aerial and satellite imagery databases.
  • Reducedrunning time by 50% using GPU acceleration and improved parallelization.

• Provided audiovisual support for classroom and campus events, ensuring seamless operation of equipment including projectors, microphones, and video conferencing systems.
  • Assisted in the installation, upgrade, and maintenance of audiovisual equipment across general pool and computer classrooms.
  • Delivered troubleshooting and on-site technical support for AV equipment to ensure minimal disruption to classroom activities.

frontmatter.title: Unity3D Developer
frontmatter.company: NVV Lab at Johns Hopkins Hospital

node.html:
• Developed a Unity 3D application for Microsoft HoloLens 2 to test peripheral vision for stroke detection in the Neuro-Visual and Vestibular Disorders Center at Johns Hopkins Hospital.
  • Designed test logic in Unity, adhering to medical guidelines and HIPAA standards.
  • Collaborated with back-end developers, HoloLens experts, and medical professionals.
  • Created user interfaces and detection algorithms using C# and .NET framework.

• Designed and maintained a responsive website for the Computational Sensory-Motor Systems lab.
  • Improved mobile compatibility and cross-browser compatibility primarily using HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, Sass, JavaScript, and jQuery
  • Added interactive elements like forms and data visualizations.
